snippet: Six years after Barbaro won the Kentucky Derby, then fractured an ankle in the Preakness and died eight months later, Michael Matz has a new contender in Union Rags.
abstract: Michael Matz, who trained 2006 Kentucky Derby winner Barbaro, is shooting for another Derby victory with new contender Union Rags. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. -- Michael Matz stood in the same barn he inhabited with Barbaro six years ago and looked down the shedrow on a gray Tuesday morning at Churchill Downs. ''I've had one great horse,'' he said. ''To think I might have a second one is an unbelievable feeling.''

headline.main: Barbaro's Trainer Going For Second Derby Win
